segment.source: Administering UE-V with PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Administering UE-V with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Administering UE-V with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Administering UE-V with PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Administering UE-V with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) provides Windows PowerShell cmdlets which can help administrators perform various UE-V tasks.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) provides Windows PowerShell cmdlets which can help administrators perform various UE-V tasks.

segment.source: The following sections provide more information about using PowerShell with UE-V.
segment.target: The following sections provide more information about using PowerShell with UE-V.

segment.source: Managing the UE-V 1.0 Agent and Packages with PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing the UE-V 1.0 Agent and Packages with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: You can use PowerShell and WMI to manage Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) Agent configuration and synchronization behavior.
segment.target: You can use PowerShell and WMI to manage Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) Agent configuration and synchronization behavior.

segment.source: Managing the UE-V 1.0 Agent and Packages with PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing the UE-V 1.0 Agent and Packages with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Managing UE-V 1.0 Settings Location Templates with PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing UE-V 1.0 Settings Location Templates with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: After you create and deploy UE-V settings location templates you can manage those templates using PowerShell or WMI.
segment.target: After you create and deploy UE-V settings location templates you can manage those templates using PowerShell or WMI.

segment.source: Managing UE-V 1.0 Settings Location Templates Using PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing UE-V 1.0 Settings Location Templates Using PowerShell and WMI
